div1.head: Letter from Mabel H. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, [December 14, 1915]
div1.p:
I hope
that you had a pleasant
birthday - sorry that we
could not have been
with you-

Hope that you will find
our gift useful.-

I had a letter from
Uncle Thomas to-day
enclosing an account
of the Lazear family-
will you tell Francis
if she has not been able
to get the dates of the
landing of the Lazear
family I will send
this copy to the pub-
lishers-

To-morrow we are
going to send our little
christmas gifts to
you - they go with
much love - if they
arrive before X mas
don't open open them-

We are having such
a down pour to-night
so far we have had
- 2 -
very little rain-

Peggy will write about
the play she was in
“Snow White”- It was
very beautifully staged
in the new little
theater in Montreal
and the audience
very grand.- Houston
seemed to enjoy it
very much-

Last week we had
a most wonderful
treat - Forbes Robertson
in Hamlet - I took both
the children - and
we all so enjoyed it-
I thought his acting
marvelous-

I must stop now
and get to work - Peggy
and I have changed
rooms - I have so
enjoyed the mountains
from her room - if your
trees keep on growing we
will loose our sea
view - We have cut
2 down since we have
been back and are
- 3 -
burning the logs in the
fire place - Mother
has a small stove in
her room in the winter
and finds it such a
comfort - with a few
sticks of wood she can
help us all out - such
heat! - It used to be
a laboring mans job
(mine) to keep ever in
wood for the open fire-

Write when you can
I always forget to tell
you that our number
AC
L
has never been changed
perhaps my writing
has- It would be a
pity I know if it had-

Tell us how old Alice
is and the dog when
you write - much
much love dear Ganny
